headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Indicted on Sex Trafficking Charges. Aired 11:30a-12:00p ET

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: And we're going to have live coverage of a Kamala Harris meeting with these black journalists at the NABJ later this afternoon around 2Karen Attiah of "The Washington Post," thanks very much for joining us.

utterances.speaker: ATTIAH
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Jim (sic). Thanks for having me.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: And coming upOur own Kara Scannell outside the courthouse for us -- Kara.

utterances.speaker: KARA SCANNELL, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Wolf, we're standing by waiting for U.S. attorney Damian Williams to begin that press conference.Then Sean Diddy Combs himself is expected to appear in court behind me around 2:30. More after the break. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Aaron Katersky, ABC.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Damian, thanks.The indictment describes aggressive, open, violent, hedonistic abuse that you say was recurrent and widely known. Why did it take law enforcement so long to intervene? How many women were victimized by Sean Combs and how many others were involved?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Look, our investigation is ongoing. We are committed to bringing justice to everyone who's been victimized by the defendant.I can't tell you why it took so long. I think the better focus is on the fact that we are here today. And we are committed to making sure that justice is done. Next question.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Julia Ainsley, NBC. QUESTIONYou said we are not done and that Combs did not do this alone. Do you foresee that there could be other charges related to this case?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm not taking anything off the table.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Janon Fisher, Newsday.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: What's the difference between sex trafficking and promoting travel for the purpose of prostitution?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, they are different crimes with different elements. I don't think we should get into the nitty-gritty of the legal discussion right now, but the sex trafficking, we believe -- they're all serious offenses, but the sex trafficking conduct carries some significant penalties.And we are gratified that we were able to bring that charge.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: One more coercive than the other?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to be able to get into that, but you can look it up. and, yes, sex trafficking, especially when it involves coercion or force, is a very serious crime and it carries significant penalties.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Good afternoon. Darla Miles, ABC7 New York. Thank you for this press conference and for the details.Two questions. In context of this indictment and the information that was presented to the grand jury, are you able to clarify the number of victims? It's mentioned plural in the indictment, but can you specify the number of victims just for this particular indictment? And, secondly, can you provide details about the alleged arson?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Unfortunately, I'm not able to provide either. The number of victims, you are correct, we are intentional in saying multiple. The details of the arson incident are limited to what we have in the indictment and also the detention letter that we filed, which contains more details than the indictment does at various points, but we don't have anything more beyond that.Next question.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Linh Tran, CNN.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Are any of his accomplices or associates under investigation? And, additionally, could he face any more charges?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So the investigation is ongoing. That means both as to him and to anyone else who we believe committed the crime with him.Next question.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm biased. I'm the U.S. attorney in the Southern District of New York. I think that we have an outstanding track record of bringing some of the most impactful, sprawling, complex, difficult sex trafficking, human trafficking, labor trafficking, you name it. The Southern District of New York can do it, and so we're very proud of that.And so the scope and complexity of this investigation isn't something that we ran from. It's something that we embrace, and we will continue to do that. As to your question about whether he imprisoned anyone, all I can say is that I mentioned this March 2016 incident where something was caught on video where a victim was attempting to flee and there was violence that was associated with it.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Was that at the residence or (OFF-MIKE)

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was at a hotel.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Matthew Lee, Inner City Press.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Thanks a lot.Does your office intend to seek remand or are you reaching a bail package? And if you're willing, how would you contrast this with the R. Kelly case in EDNY in terms of the elements? Thanks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, we will be seeking detention. We have filed a letter laying out our reasoning for seeking pretrial detention. I'm not going to be able to expand beyond what's in the letter, but it contains all of the reasoning and it contains the law as well.There is a presumption of detention in a case like this and we think that's warranted.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: John Annese, "New York Daily News."

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Thank you.I was hoping to get some more detail about the searches of his residence, the guns, the cases of lubricant and the videos. Where were they found amongst his residence? Were they all scattered around the houses, in one place? So I kind of wanted to just get a better picture of how that stuff was found. WILLIAMS:  Well, look, I think that some of the details that you're seeking are in the detention letter. So, for instance, some of the AR- 15s, two of the three defaced AR-15s were found in his bedroom closet in Miami, broken down into parts, along with magazines, with ammunition loaded in them. So some of that detail is in the detention letter. Beyond that, I'm not going to be able to get into where other items were stored.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ben Kochman, "Post."

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Hey.Thanks for doing this.Your office was the office that had been prosecuting Jeffrey Epstein before he died in custody. I have not read your detention memo yet. It's the first thing I'm going to do after this ends. But does it -- does the memo address or is your office concerned with Combs' safety in custody, given what happened with Epstein?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So we are concerned with anyone's safety whenever they are detained prior to trial. It's part of our obligations to keep people safe as well. It's part of the criminal justice system.So -- but I do not draw any sort of connection between Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and what may or may not happen to any other defendant while they are detained pretrial. And, of course, the decision whether to detain the defendant will be up to a judge. Our position is that pretrial detention is warranted under the law and based on the facts of this case. And I will leave it at that.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Are some of the prosecutors on this case some of the same prosecutors that had been handling that or that worked on the Maxwell case?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, I'm not going to get into the staffing. I will say that this team, this group of AUSAs, this incredible group, has been working on this case around the clock and they have had their hands full.Next question.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Gus Rosendale, NBC News.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Good morning, sir.Combs' attorney said that his client has been cooperative with investigators. He said that this morning. I was wondering if you would have a reaction to that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say this. I think that, generally, with increasing frequency, the word cooperative or cooperating has taken on tremendous elasticity and it no longer really bears any relation to what the word means when we use it in a very specific context.So, responding to lawful process and the like does not qualify as cooperation when we use that term here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mike Sisak, AP.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to be able to get into any sort of operational details as to how he was taken into custody and when.He is in custody right now. He will be appearing in court later today.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Was there any discussion of him surrendering, given they claim he's cooperating?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to be able to get into law enforcement tactics or operations.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: (OFF-MIKE)

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I can't get into the charging decision. It is very meaningful to us that weapons were possessed. As we allege in the indictment, part of the reason why this conduct was so pervasive and harmful was because victims and others didn't necessarily feel comfortable denying him his wishes, as we allege, because of the presence of firearms.I should leave it there.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thanks. Last question, Jacob Shamsian.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Jacob Shamsian, "Business Insider." Thank you.Given that he's the sole defendant in this case and that you alleged he's part of a conspiracy that involves members of his companies, do you anticipate a superseding indictment that will bring allegations against other members of his companies or other co-conspirators as well?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Again, I can't take anything off the table. Anything is possible. Our investigation is very active and ongoing. And I think a lot of you who cover this office know that when we say such things, that developments are certainly foreseeable. But I cannot predict them sitting here today.All right, thank you, everyone.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: All right, so there you have Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, which, of course, includes New York City right there, outlining this case, these charges that have been filed now, sex trafficking and racketeering against Sean "Diddy" Combs.Kara Scannell is our correspondent. She's just outside the courthouse. You have been watching and reporting on this extensively, Kara. first of all, tell us what Sean "Diddy" Combs' lawyers are saying about this.

utterances.speaker: SCANNELL
utterances.sentences: Sean "Diddy" Combs' lawyers are saying that he's going to plead not guilty when he does appear before a federal judge later today. They say that they are going to fight like hell to try to get him released on bail.But you just heard from Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, and that office is seeking detention. They do not want Sean "Diddy" Combs to walk out of this courthouse today. I was just reading through the detention letter that they filed with the court, and they lay out a number of reasons, including Combs' history of violence. They report, according to their allegations, that he has kicked, shoved, abused women for years. They also say that he is a flight risk because of his access to money and planes. They also note a number of weapons that they recovered in the search of his homes in L.A. and Miami earlier this year, including some serious weapons that they included pictures of at that press conference, saying that he has access to weapons, both himself and through his security staff, noting that some of his security staff are criminals, in fact. They also say that another reason why Diddy should be detained is because he has tried to obstruct this very investigation, saying that he has tried to tamper with witnesses, had reached out to a number of witnesses in this investigation, asking them to create what he said was -- what the U.S. attorney's office said was a false narrative, and some of those conversations were actually recorded on the phone of one of the co-conspirators, according to the U.S. attorney's office -- Wolf.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: All right, Kara, stand by. I'm going to get back to you.Elie Honig is with us. Elie, you're a former assistant U.S. attorney in the Southern District of New York. You know a lot about this case. When we heard Damian Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, just say they will seek pretrial detention,that means that they're not going to allow bail to let this guy walk around; is that right?

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: Yes, racketeering, sex trafficking, and arson, a lot of charges against Sean "Diddy" Combs.Stand by. Josh Campbell is with us as well. Josh, the U.S. attorney in the Southern District of New York, Damian Williams, just said they're not done by any means. This investigation is ongoing. Give us your sense of what he's suggesting.

utterances.speaker: JOSH CAMPBELL, CNN SECURITY CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, they're alleging that his business was a criminal enterprise, and this is a racketeering case. So there are others involved.We know from this indictment, Wolf, they're alleging the members of the security staff, his administrative staff, his household staff, and others were also involved. And so we're waiting to see if others will indeed be charged, the U.S. attorney there saying that this remains an ongoing investigation. Wolf, they're also calling on any additional witnesses to come forward if they have additional information.
